question.text: Choose the incorrect statement about gymnosperms.

options.text: The cones bearing megasporophylls with ovules or megasporangia are called female strobili.
In gymnosperms, the male and the female gametophytes do not have an independent free-living existence.
The gymnosperms are homosporous in nature.
One of the gymnosperms, the giant redwood tree Sequoia is one of the tallest tree species.

solution.text: The gymnosperms are heterosporous; they produce haploid microspores and megaspores.  The two kinds of spores are produced within sporangia that are borne on sporophylls which are arranged spirally along an axis to form lax or compact strobili or cones.
